alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 8:56AM CST until February 24 at 2:10PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Tennessee... Elk River above Fayetteville affecting Lincoln and Franklin TN Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Elk River above Fayetteville. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Flood waters reach residential areas in low lying areas of Fayetteville. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 20.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:15 AM CST Wednesday was 20.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 21.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning to 5.5 feet and begin rising again early Saturday afternoon. It will rise to 8.6 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 17.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 21.5 feet on 09/20/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
